name: treatment of leach residue from copper production, neutralisation | leach residue from copper production | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23384/documentation

The dataset represents the neutralisation of residues from the leaching and solvent extraction of milled copper-cobalt ores (Nisbett et al. 2009). ;References:;Nisbett, A., Baxter, K., Marte, K., & Urbani, M. (2009). Flowsheet considerations for copper cobalt projects. Journal of the Southern African Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, 109(11), 641â€“646.

Activity starts with the reception of the waste.

Activity ends with neutralised wastes ready for disposal or further treatment.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period estimated based on year of publication.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are representative of conditions in Zambia and the Democratic Republic of Congo, which are used to represent typical global conditions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Activity based on the metallurgical flowsheet from the Tailings Leach Plant at Nchanga, Zambia. The plant accepts milled copper-cobalt ore solids, which are leached on site. Raffinate is treated through a two-stage solvent exchange process. Residues from the leaching and solvent exchange processes are treated through neutralisation, which is the step represented in this dataset. ;Activity based on the metallurgical flowsheet from the Tailings Leach Plant at Nchanga, Zambia. The plant accepts milled copper-cobalt ore solids, which are leached on site. Raffinate is treated through a two-stage solvent exchange process. Residues from the leaching and solvent exchange processes are treated through neutralisation, which is the step represented in this dataset.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data are extrapolated from one site in Zambia tp represent global treatment.

flow.name: leach residue from copper production
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

exchanges.description: After neutralisation, wastes are generally considered as hazardous and are disposed of in impoundments or in underground deposits. Here, neutralisation wastes are approximated with sulfidic tailings, from copper mine operation. The amount was calculated through mass balance.

flow.name: sulfidic tailings, from copper mine operation
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

exchanges.description: The amount of limestone added for neutralisation was calculated from data reported in Nisbett et al. (2009), who present a flowsheet for a conventional copper and cobalt hydrometallurgical process.

flow.name: limestone, crushed, washed
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
